summary.en:
Your Right to Quality Health Care

  • All medical staff should communicate with you throughout your visit. You have the right to an interpreter.
  • If you are unsure of anything that is happening to you, you have a right to ask them to stop and explain what is happening.
  • You also have a right to decline care or to ask for more information before consenting to any procedure or intervention.

The Home and Community Care (HACC) Program outlines the following rights.

  • be treated with respect and courtesy
  • have your needs assessed
  • be informed and part of the decisions made about your care
  • receive quality services
  • have the right to make a complaint
  • have someone represent you (an advocate)
  • have your privacy and confidentiality respected and to access all personal information kept about you by the service

See here for more.

Your Responsibilities

  • Treat staff with respect and courtesy – for example, by letting them know as soon as possible if you cannot keep an appointment.
  • Provide a safe work environment for staff and help them to provide you with services safely – for example by not smoking while staff are present
  • Take responsibility for the results of any decisions which you make

حقوقك في ا يثاق ا سترالي قوق الرعاية الصحية

  • ا صول - ا ق في ا صول على الرعاية الصحية.
  • الس مة - ا ق في تلقي الرعاية الصحية ا منة وذات ا ودة العالية.
  • ا حترام – لديك ا ق في أن ظى با حترام، وإلى أن يعاملوك بكرامة وإعتبار.
  • ا تصا ت - ا ق في ا صول على معلومات حول ا دمات والع ج وا يارات والتكاليف بطريقة واضحة ومفتوحة.
  • ا شاركة - ا ق في أن يتم إدراجك في اتخاذ القرارات وعمل ا يارات بشأن الرعاية الصحية ا اصة بك.
  • ا صوصية - ا ق في ا صوصية وسرية ا علومات الشخصية ا اصة بك.
  • التعليق - ا ق في التعليق على الرعاية الصحية ا اصة بك، وإلى أن تتم معا ةمخاوفك
